title: Doug Stone-Greatest Hits Volume One
description:
Track Listing
1. Little Houses
2. Too Busy Being in Love
3. Jukebox With a Country Song, A
4. Made For Lovin&#039; You
5. Why Didn&#039;t I Think of That
6. In a Different Light
7. Come in Out of the Pain
8. Warning Labels
9. I Thought It Was You
10. I&#039;d Be Better Off (In a Pine Box)

Details 
Contributing artists: Mac McAnally, Mark O&#039;Connor, Matt Rollings 
Distributor: Sony Music Distribution ( 
Recording Type: Studio 
Recording Mode: Stereo 
SPAR Code: n/a 

Album Notes
Producers: Doug Stone, James Stroud, Doug Johnson.
Fans will rejoice at this "best of" collection from Doug Stone, the man with the smoothest baritones in country music.
VOLUME 1 includes such early hits as "I Thought It Was You"; the tear-in-the-beer "Warning Labels" (as in "they oughta put warning labels on those sad country songs"); and the sorry-for-himself lament "I&#039;d Be Better Off (In A Pine Box)." It also contains the tender new release "Little Houses," as well as the biggest song of Stone&#039;s career, the snappy honky tonk nugget "Jukebox With A Country Song." On other cuts Doug explores the nuances of relationships, from the obvious regretfulness of the upbeat "Why Didn&#039;t I Think Of That," to the wistful longing of "Different Light."
The ballad is, in fact, this sentimental crooner&#039;s forte; whether inspired by deep love or bottomless heartbreak, Stone&#039;s voice is able to reach deep into the listener&#039;s soul with its velvety, woeful inflections. At times, it has a similar vibrato to Aaron Neville, and the deep resonance of George Jones, combining to create a unique dramatic style.
